intro: Pleconax subconica, commonly known as the narrow-conical pleconax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, conical stem and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
